meanings.definition: The evening or day before a particular event or festival.
meanings.sent1: On the eves of holidays, families often gather to celebrate together.
meanings.sent2: The eves of birthdays are filled with excitement and anticipation.
meanings.sent3: The eves of Halloween bring out the creativity in costume planning.
meanings.sent4: The eves of New Year's Eve are like a countdown to new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The eves of Christmas are magical with twinkling lights and carolers.

meanings.definition: The period of time just before an important event.
meanings.sent1: Students feel nervous on the eves of exams.
meanings.sent2: The eves of weddings are often busy with last-minute preparations.
meanings.sent3: The eves of vacations are filled with packing and excitement.
meanings.sent4: The eves of parties buzz with anticipation and energy.
meanings.sent5: The eves of graduations are bittersweet with farewells and new beginnings.

meanings.definition: The edge or rim of a roof.
meanings.sent1: Birds often perch on the eves of houses to rest.
meanings.sent2: The snow gathered on the eves of the cabin, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed onto the eves of the barn to escape the barking dog.
meanings.sent4: The rain dripped off the eves of the roof, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel ran along the eves of the building, searching for a cozy spot.
